meanings.definition: A device used in music to mark time by regularly recurring ticks or flashes at adjustable intervals.
meanings.sent1: During the concert, the metronomes helped the musicians stay in sync.
meanings.sent2: She practiced playing the piano with the help of metronomes.
meanings.sent3: The metronomes at the music store had a dance-off when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The metronomes in the orchestra were like tiny timekeepers guiding the musicians.
meanings.sent5: The metronomes on the shelf seemed to be whispering a secret rhythm to each other.

meanings.definition: A mechanical or electrical instrument that makes repeated clicking sounds at an adjustable pace, used for marking rhythm, especially in practicing music.
meanings.sent1: The metronomes on the table clicked steadily, helping her keep the beat.
meanings.sent2: He set up the metronomes to practice his drumming skills.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted at the metronomes, creating a chaotic rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The metronomes in the room echoed like a chorus of tiny dancers.
meanings.sent5: The metronomes' clicks filled the room, creating a symphony of time.
